intro: Ilex sideroxyloides f. vulgaris, commonly known as the common holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves that are typically alternate and have spiny margins. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. These berries are an important food source for various bird species. Ilex sideroxyloides f. vulgaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature in temperate climates.
